meanings.definition: External fortifications or defenses surrounding a fortress or city.
meanings.sent1: The outworks of the castle were tall stone walls protecting the inner keep.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers defended the city by manning the outworks during the siege.
meanings.sent3: The outworks of the fortress were so strong that even the enemy's best efforts couldn't breach them.
meanings.sent4: The outworks stood like vigilant guardians, keeping the city safe from harm.
meanings.sent5: The outworks were like a sturdy shield, shielding the heart of the city from any danger.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo in work or performance.
meanings.sent1: She always outworks her colleagues by putting in extra effort and dedication.
meanings.sent2: The team leader consistently outworks everyone else in meeting project deadlines.
meanings.sent3: He outworks his competitors by constantly striving to improve his skills.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's determination to outwork his previous records led to his success.
meanings.sent5: Outworking oneself is the key to achieving personal growth and success in life.
